'''Slakoth''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ナマケロ''' ''Namakero'') is a {{type|Normal}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Vigoroth}} starting at [[level]] 18, which evolves into {{p|Slaking}} starting at [[level]] 36.

==Biology==
Slakoth is a brown, quadruped Pokémon with sloth-like qualities. It has coarse, shaggy fur with two dark brown stripes on its back. There is a scruff of fur on top of its head, and it has a large, pig-like pink nose, pink eyelids, and dark rings around its eyes. It has long, lanky arms, but shorter legs. Each paw has two sharp claws, and there are pink paw pads on the back feet. Its underbelly and read are also pink.

Slakoth lolls around and sleeps for more than twenty hours a day, which can makes those around it drowsy. Since it does not move very much, it does not need much food and only eats three leaves each day. Its heart only beats once a minute. It is capable of regaining lost energy through use of its former [[signature move]], {{m|Slack Off}}. It makes its nest in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Forest Pokémon|forests,}} and keeps the same one during its entire life. However, it can travel far by swimming in rivers.

==In the anime==
[[File:Marcel Slakoth.png|thumb|210px|left|Slakoth in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
[[Norman]]'s Slakoth appeared in ''[[AG069|Love, Petalburg Style]]'' and ''[[AG070|Balance of Power]]''. It was used in his Gym Battle against Ash, where it battled {{AP|Pikachu}} and {{AP|Torkoal}}. It proved to be a strong battler against Pikachu with its powerful {{m|Blizzard}} attack, but it lost to Torkoal.

In ''[[AG088|The Garden of Eatin']]'', there were many Slakoth who lived in the [[Banana Slakoth Garden]] which is run by [[Marcel]]. A {{DL|Marcel|Snorlax}} was eating all the bananas in the garden and no one was able to stop it until one of the Slakoth in the garden evolved into {{p|Vigoroth}} and defeated it.

===Minor appearances===
Slakoth debuted in [[Max]]'s flashback in ''[[AG034|Having a Wailord of a Time]]''.

A Slakoth appeared in ''[[AG119|The Ribbon Cup Caper]]'' at the S.S. St. Flower's [[Pokémon Center]].

{{OBP|Mitchell|DP088}} used a Slakoth during the first activity of the [[Pokémon Summer Academy]] in ''[[DP088|Camping It Up!]]''.

A {{pkmn|Coordinator}}'s Slakoth was used in the [[Contest Battle|Battle Stage]] of the {{to|Daybreak}} {{pkmn|Contest}} along with a {{p|Shroomish}} in ''[[DP162|Playing the Performance Encore!]]''.

A Slakoth appeared in ''[[XY002|Lumiose City Pursuit!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Dwarf Amnesia.png|thumb|200px|Slakoth in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Ash & Pikachu manga===
[[Norman]]'s Slakoth appeared in ''[[SP25|I'll Win With My Own Battle Style!!]]''.

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A Slakoth, nicknamed Dwarf, under the ownership of Mr. Dutch appeared while {{adv|Ruby}} was participating in a Pokémon Contest in ''[[PS200|Tripped Up by Torkoal]]''.

In ''[[PS264|It All Ends Now V]]'', [[Norman]] was seen with two Slakoth that he used to try to stop {{adv|Rayquaza}} from fleeing from its confines.

A Slakoth appeared in ''[[PS525|The Transfer Student]]''.

===In the Pokémon Ruby-Sapphire manga===
In the [[Pokémon Ruby-Sapphire]] manga, Norman owns a Slakoth. In ''[[PMRS04|There's Someone More Important Than Clefairy?!]]'', it swallows the {{badge|Balance}} and [[Red's Clefairy]] helps to retrieve it from its stomach.

===NPC appearances===

==Trivia==
* Slakoth is one of fourteen Pokémon that one could collect [[foreign Pokédex entries]] for in {{game|Diamond and Pearl|s}}.

===Origin===
As its name implies, it appears to have been based on sloths, specifically two-toed sloths.

====Name origin====
Slakoth may be a combination of ''slack'' (to be lazy) and ''{{wp|sloth}}'' as well as a play on the phrase "to slack off."

Namakero may be a combination of 樹懶 ''namakemono'' (sloth) and なまける ''namakeru'' (slack off).
